result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: copy of Judgment of Dismissal/Acquittal returned from jail address marked  "Return to Sender, vacant, unable to forward."

Cases called: 14CF101 & 14CF140, Defendant Raymond E Crowe in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 4. Persistent repeater dismissed. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. PSI ordered, to be completed within 60 days.   All other counts and 14CF140 read in and dismissed.

Defendant Raymond E Crowe by video, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana, in courtroom.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to get put back into general population.  State does not object to him being put back into general population.  If defendant is put back into general population, he will have phone usage.  State objects to the phone usage.  Court denied motion.

Defendant Raymond E Crowe in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Court granted 30 days for motions.
Preliminary hearing on September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Cases heard: 14CF101 & 14CF140, Defendant Raymond E Crowe in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  ADA Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense stands mute on the competency to stand trial. Court found defendant able to assist in his own defense. Atty. Masana entered not guilty by mental disease/defect in 14CF101 case. Order to be prepared. Other case to be set for preliminary hearing.
Filed by Peter Masana

Defendant Raymond E Crowe in court, in custody pro se.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recited right to counsel & time limits. Defendant waived attorney and time limits. 14CF101 to track with this case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:20 pm.  Hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
